tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE energy_transactions_history (
    transaction_id SERIAL PRIMARY KEY,
    energy_provider VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    energy_consumer VARCHAR(255) NOT NULL,
    energy_amount DECIMAL NOT NULL,
    transaction_date TIMESTAMP NOT NULL
);

CREATE TABLE energy_transactions (
  transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  transaction_date DATE,
  energy_source VARCHAR(100),
  energy_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  client_id INT
);

CREATE TABLE energy_transaction_history (
  history_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  transaction_id INT,
  previous_energy_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  current_energy_amount DECIMAL(10, 2),
  transaction_date DATE,
  CONSTRAINT fk_transaction_id FOREIGN KEY (transaction_id) REFERENCES energy_transactions(transaction_id)
);

CREATE TABLE energy_transactions (
    transaction_id UUID PRIMARY KEY,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    source VARCHAR,
    destination VARCHAR,
    energy_amount DECIMAL
);

CREATE TABLE EnergyTransactions (
    transaction_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    consumer_id INT,
    provider_id INT,
    transaction_date DATE,
    energy_amount FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (consumer_id) REFERENCES EnergyConsumers(consumer_id),
    FOREIGN KEY (provider_id) REFERENCES EnergyProviders(provider_id)
);

CREATE TABLE EnergyMeterReadings (
    reading_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    consumer_id INT,
    reading_date DATE,
    meter_reading FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (consumer_id) REFERENCES EnergyConsumers(consumer_id)
);

CREATE TABLE EnergyPayments (
    payment_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    transaction_id INT,
    payment_date DATE,
    amount_paid FLOAT,
    FOREIGN KEY (transaction_id) REFERENCES EnergyTransactions(transaction_id)
);
